alert.note: Alert for Redwood; Renville (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 9:45PM CDT until May 22 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. Minnesota River at New Ulm affecting Brown, Blue Earth and Nicollet Counties. Minnesota River at Mankato affecting Blue Earth and Nicollet Counties. Minnesota River at Savage affecting Carver, Scott, Hennepin and Dakota Counties. Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. Cannon River at Northfield affecting Rice and Dakota Counties. Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. Minnesota River at Henderson MN19 affecting Le Sueur, Sibley and Scott Counties. Minnesota River near Jordan affecting Carver, Sibley and Scott Counties. .Heavy rainfall across southern Minnesota this weekend has caused significant rises in area rivers. River levels should crest within the next few days and then slowly fall as a dry weather pattern prevails. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, MAY 22... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Morton. * WHEN...Until Monday, May 22. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Riverside Rd and Front Street flooded in North Redwood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Sunday, the stage was 22.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 PM CDT Sunday was 22.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage next Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.0 feet on 10/12/2018. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
